cufy.convert

Class AbstractConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • cufy.convert.AbstractConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Converter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseConverter

    public abstract class AbstractConverter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Converter
    An abstract class for converter classes. Used to simplify the conversion processes and make it more inheritable. Also making the inheriting for adding some futures more easier. Methods in this class will be invoked using the dynamic method grouping algorithm. In order to add a method on a dynamic method group. The method should be annotated with that group annotation. Also the method should match the conditions of that group to avoid parameters/output mismatches.
    Since:
    31-Aug-2019
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    lsafer

        public <I,O> O convert(ConvertToken<I,O> token)
        Description copied from interface: Converter
        Set the ConvertToken.output on the given token to a value of the ConvertToken.input, but as the class specified as in the ConvertToken.outputClazz.
        Specified by:
        convert in interface Converter
        Type Parameters:
        I - the ConvertToken.input of the given token
        O - the ConvertToken.output of the given token after the converting process
        Parameters:
        token - the conversion instance that holds the variables of this conversion
        Returns:
        the output

      • convert0

        protected void convert0(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                        ConvertToken token)
        Invoke the given ConvertMethod with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        method - to be invoked
        token - the conversion instance that holds the variables of this conversion
        Throws:
        ConvertException - if any converting error occurred
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the given parameters is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given method have limited access. Or if the given method have illegal parameters count

      • convertElse

        protected void convertElse(ConvertToken token)
        Get invoked if no conversion method is found for the given token.

        Note: called dynamically. No need for direct call

        Parameters:
        token - the conversion instance that holds the variables of this conversion
        Throws:
        ConvertException - if any converting error occurred
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given token is null

      • convertPre

        protected boolean convertPre(ConvertToken token)
        Operations to be done before any converting action.
        Parameters:
        token - the token provided by the caller
        Returns:
        whether the converting process should be continued or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'token' is null
        ConvertException - if any converting exception occurs

      • getConvertMethod

        protected java.lang.reflect.Method getConvertMethod(java.lang.Class inputClass,
                                                    java.lang.Class outputClass)
        Find a method that converts the given 'inputClass' to the given 'outputClass'.
        Parameters:
        inputClass - type that the targeted method can except as a parameter
        outputClass - type that the targeted method can return
        Returns:
        a method that can convert the given inputClass to the given outputClass class
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the given parameters is null
